items.title: Canberra man Michael O'Connell sentenced to 10 years in jail for manslaughter of partner Danielle Jordan
items.summary: A Canberra man is sentenced to 10 years in jail for manslaughter, after the ACT Court of Appeal overturned his murder conviction for the death of his partner.

items.title: Gangster Mejid Hamzy's enemies and 'torture plot' revealed as alleged gangland assassins found not guilty
items.summary: Mejid Hamzy's murder sparked Sydney's deadliest gangland war in a generation. For two years what led to his demise has been a secret.

items.title: Cost of living remains a sore point for voters as political year wraps
items.summary: A mammoth year in politics ended with a focus on what is worrying most Australians ahead of Christmas: the cost of living.

items.title: Government will not say if further Australian family members of Islamic State fighters on track to return
items.summary: The Coalition seizes on meeting notes from June to claim the government is working to return Australian children and partners of Islamic State fighters.

items.title: Father of the baby bonus Peter Costello wants falling fertility rate 'back on the agenda'
items.summary: With Australia's fertility rate at a new low and concerns about its economic impact on the future, the former treasurer behind the early 2000s baby boom says all options should be on the table to encourage more children.

items.title: Police offer $500k reward for information on toddler Jordan Thompson's overdose death
items.summary: NSW police are urging anyone with information about toddler Jordan Thompson's 2005 death to come forward as they increase the reward on offer.

items.title: Ashes 2025 updates: Australia vs England, Joe Root scores century, Mitchell Starc takes six wickets on day one of the second Test in Brisbane
items.summary: Joe Root scores the first Ashes century of his career on Australian soil, as Mitchell Starc's 6-71 enlivens a thrilling day of Test cricket.

items.title: Why former Melbourne enforcer Nelson Asofa-Solomona chose boxing over rugby league
items.summary: Former Melbourne enforcer Nelson Asofa-Solomona reveals how he fell out of love with rugby league and turned down lucrative contract offers to pursue a career in boxing.

items.title: Beer box musician, land rights champion and NT administrator Ted Egan's 'big and generous life'
items.summary: A former Government House occupant and a prolific author and historian, Ted Egan will also be remembered as the man who reinvented the beer box as a musical instrument.

items.title: Anti-bullying review recommends making kids 'upstanders'. Does it work?
items.summary: Research suggests that actively encouraging students to be 'upstanders' to bullying may even be counterproductive.

items.title: Steve Cropper, legendary guitarist for Booker T and the MG's, dies aged 84
items.summary: Steve Cropper, was best known as the guitarist for Booker T and the MG's, but also co-wrote the classics Green Onions, and In the Midnight Hour.

items.title: Former NT administrator, musician and author Ted Egan dies aged 93
items.summary: Folk music legend, author and former Northern Territory administrator Ted Egan has died aged 93.

items.title: Indonesian environmentalists blame rapid forest loss in Sumatra for severity of deadly floods
items.summary: Indonesia's government says it will summon eight companies over their suspected role in worsening the scale of floods and landslides that have killed more than 700 people. But environmental groups say authorities are hypocritical and partly to blame for the destruction.

items.title: Radio presenters with disability thrive at 8CCC in Alice Springs
items.summary: A community radio station in Alice Springs is becoming a breeding ground for new, diverse voices by giving people with disability a platform to broadcast.

items.title: Opal mining to continue on land cut out from new Qld national park, formerly Vergemont Station
items.summary: The Queensland government's purchase of Vergemont Station last year led to months of uncertainty for miners with tenures inside the former cattle station, which is larger than the Australian Capital Territory.

items.title: Broome man who killed non-biological brother not guilty of murder due to mental impairment
items.summary: A special proceedings hearing in the Supreme Court in Broome heard that Ian Ralph Brooke was suffering from an acute psychotic disorder when he fatally stabbed a 27-year-old in 2023.

items.title: Cricket fan's mission to crisscross Australia on his yellow Vespa to attend every Ashes Test
items.summary: One man, one little yellow Vespa and a 12,000-kilometre road trip to attend every Ashes Test.

items.title: Hobart stadium get final approval in state's upper house, clearing way for AFL team — as it happened
items.summary: The Hobart stadium has received final parliamentary approval, clearing the way for it to be built and the state to claim its own AFL team.

items.title: Western Australia's Payarri people celebrate state's 150th native title determination after 30-year journey
items.summary: It was 1994 when Ngalia man Kado Muir first sat down with two of his elders and a lawyer to discuss lodging a native title claim for his ancestral country, Payarri. Today, the Federal Court will make an on-country determination of that claim.

items.title: Pentagon watchdog finds Hegseth's use of Signal posed risk to US personnel
items.summary: A report by the Pentagon watchdog concludes US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth violated Pentagon policy by using his personal device for official business and recommends better training for all Pentagon officials.

items.title: Raccoon goes on drunken rampage in US liquor store
items.summary: The suspect broke into a liquor store in the US state of Virginia, ransacked several shelves and ended up face down in the bathroom.

items.title: Large gorilla sculpture installed in Batemans Bay park divides opinion
items.summary: A statue of a 30-year-old eastern lowland gorilla named Mina is one of 22 donated to Eurobodalla Shire Council by internationally recognised artists Gillie and Marc.

items.title: Remote community in WA's Pilbara saves $400k of food after truck breaks down
items.summary: A mammoth effort by community members saves $400,000 worth of food for the Punmu remote community, but the incident reignites the debate about the condition of WA's most remote roads.

items.title: Increasing wait times for mammograms could have 'potentially tragic' consequences
items.summary: A Medicare funding freeze and high cost of training new students has left a shortage of workers and blown out wait times of critical diagnostic services.

items.title: Wallabies and All Blacks drawn into same group for first time at 2027 Rugby World Cup
items.summary: Wallabies coach Joe Schmidt says he is unlikely to be coaching the All Blacks at the World Cup, as Australia and New Zealand are drawn into the same group.

items.title: EU proposes using frozen Russian assets as repatriation loans for Ukraine
items.summary: Belgium is pushing back on a European proposal to use frozen Russian assets to help financially support Ukraine.

items.title: Video of Jeffrey Epstein's private island released by US Democrats
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Richard Marles says he is 'working through' AUKUS review from the US – as it happened
items.summary: The acting prime minister says the United States is fully supportive of AUKUS and has thanked it for providing a review.

items.title: Aged home care package changes set off cash conflict between providers and suppliers
items.summary: Care providers are trying to strongarm cash from suppliers of equipment, including wheelchairs, a month after the federal government reformed home care packages for senior Australians.

items.title: Homegrown trainee Darrenia Carr helps fill recruitment gap in Tennant Creek art centre
items.summary: An apprenticeship program in a remote Northern Territory town is helping businesses find skilled workers by connecting homegrown teens to local employment.

items.title: Steve Smith says adaptability is Australia's focus heading into the second Ashes Test at the Gabba
items.summary: Steve Smith reveals the mindset Australia is taking into the second Test as the Aussies look to go up 2–0 in the Ashes.

items.title: Maddy sees the world through a 'glitter jar' but has still become a national tennis champion
items.summary: Victorian teenager Maddy Kelly was 11 years old when she started losing her sight. Two years later, she's a national tennis champion.

items.title: Gold Coast beaches eroded by Cyclone Alfred all open in time for summer holidays
items.summary: Severe erosion caused by Cyclone Alfred forced the closure of several beaches in March. Now, extra lifeguards are being recruited as they anticipate a busy summer period.

items.title: Superstar Twiggy on the documentary of her storied life
items.summary: For the first time, the much-loved English model, actress and singer tells her own story in a new documentary by Sadie Frost.

items.title: China halts Japanese cultural events after tensions rise over Taiwan remarks
items.summary: Beijing halts more than 20 Japanese cultural events across China as its diplomatic spat with Japan escalates.

items.title: New images of Jeffrey Epstein's island released as Ghislaine Maxwell flags bid for freedom
items.summary: Democrats say the newly released images provide a "harrowing look" into Jeffrey Epstein's world, as the late sex offender's jailed accomplice, Ghislaine Maxwell, informs a court she is planning to challenge her imprisonment.

items.title: Parents, cancer patients say lack of proton therapy in Australia is 'an embarrassment'
items.summary: When seven-month-old Evelyn was diagnosed with a rare cancer, her mother was told proton beam therapy would be her daughter's best chance for survival. But the treatment was not available in Australia and still is not three years later.

items.title: Most renters avoid heating and cooling homes due to costs
items.summary: A new report finds that about 70 per cent of renters were avoiding heating and cooling their homes to save money. Some experts and advocates are calling for stronger minimum energy standards across the country.

items.title: Australia's teen social media ban has unofficially begun. Here's what you need to know
items.summary: December 4 marked the unofficial start of the teen social media ban. Here's everything you need to know.

items.title: NSW council votes to stop flying Indigenous flags and enforce permissions for Welcome to Country
items.summary: A mayor in southern NSW says removing the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander flags from council meeting chambers will "promote civic neutrality".

items.title: Here is what we know about the Russia–Ukraine war peace negotiations
items.summary: After a flurry of meetings, Russia's war in Ukraine continues. So where is the peace process at?

items.title: Survivors of child sexual abuse face growing National Redress Scheme wait times
items.summary: An independent audit of the National Redress Scheme has found wait times are increasing and causing significant distress to survivors of child sexual abuse.

items.title: Spotify Wrapped 2025: Bad Bunny takes global top artist spot for fourth time
items.summary: Spotify Wrapped is back for 2025, with Bad Bunny taking the top spot for global artist for a fourth time.

items.title: One player's case against the world's biggest crypto casino
items.summary: Chat logs and gambling data show the tactics used by Australian-run online casino Stake to keep one user hooked.

items.title: Energy watchdog flags 5 per cent fall in power prices amid renewables surge
items.summary: An energy watchdog says more renewable energy is projected to lower prices, but others warn the promise is illusory and more pain is coming.

items.title: Jimmy Barnes: The story behind Working Class Man and his American dream
items.summary: Cold Chisel was over. America beckoned. And Jimmy Barnes was terrified. This is the story of the album that made him, and the song that saved him.

items.title: Three issues reveal Albanese government's record on trust and integrity
items.summary: Despite holding a commanding position, Anthony Albanese knows the global trend of sliding trust in government isn't one to be taken lightly.

items.title: EU's former diplomat Federica Mogherini charged in 'fraud and corruption' probe
items.summary: European prosecutors are investigating suspicions of fraud related to an EU-funded training scheme for junior diplomats.

items.title: WA's surrogacy and IVF laws overhauled as legislation passes state parliament
items.summary: Same-sex couples, single people, transgender and intersex West Australians will be able to access assisted reproductive technology and surrogacy, almost a decade after reforms were first promised.

items.title: Australia to provide Ukraine with $95m funding boost
items.summary: Australia will provide an additional $95 million in military assistance to Ukraine and slap a fresh round of sanctions on ships believed to be part of Moscow's so-called "shadow fleet".

items.title: Australia's oil refineries will need government support to avoid a reliance on fuel imports
items.summary: With just two refineries left and 80 per cent of liquid fuel being imported, experts are warning Australia is increasingly vulnerable to global supply shocks.

items.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Man with alleged links to 'Afghan crew' accused of lying to get home loan
items.summary: Ali Jundi was arrested as part of an investigation into the Alameddine crime family, with police alleging he was part of the "Afghan crew".

items.title: Footballer sacked, youth worker charged after 'last-minute' intel leads to drug drop police sting
items.summary: A regional Victorian footballer and youth worker are facing drug trafficking charges after being caught with a package allegedly containing illegal drugs.

items.title: Jodie Hill denies involvement in alleged murder of 72-year-old Dimboola man John Hunter
items.summary: A woman on trial for the alleged murder of 72-year-old Victorian man John Hunter tells the Supreme Court she was present when he was attacked but another person was responsible for his death.

items.title: First community-designed, culture-led home from new outback housing initiative arrives in Tennant Creek
items.summary: A one-of-a-kind home, designed with the input of Tennant Creek families, has rolled up the Stuart Highway from Adelaide on a convoy of trucks. It is part of a new initiative aiming to transform housing in remote First Nations communities.

items.title: Coalition has 'no confidence' social media ban will work under Labor
items.summary: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley says Australia's social media ban will not work under Labor, as the federal government rejects YouTube's claim it will make kids "less safe".

items.title: Hobart stadium to pass Tasmanian parliament after support from independents
items.summary: A stadium on Hobart's waterfront has gained enough support to pass parliament, after independents Casey Hiscutt, Bec Thomas and Tania Rattray declared they would support the contentious project.

items.title: Ryan Papenhuyzen unsure if he'll ever return to professional sport after Melbourne Storm exit
items.summary: Former Melbourne fullback Ryan Papenhuyzen says his future is a "blank canvas" ahead of a break from professional sport that he admits could end up being permanent.

items.title: Residential zoning changes proposed for Brisbane as council pursues 'anti-sprawl' housing approach
items.summary: The proposed changes, including to block sizes and car parking requirements, are intended to add an additional 6,000 homes by 2032.

items.title: What the latest GDP numbers mean for interest rates and the economy
items.summary: Australia's latest economic growth numbers show an economy in generally rude health, but that might result in a rude shock for mortgage borrowers earlier rather than later in 2026.

items.title: Algal bloom inquiry quizzes health chief about respiratory illness concerns
items.summary: South Australia's public health chief says there is a need for more data analysis to determine whether there has been an increase in respiratory illness linked to the state's algal bloom.

items.title: Man killed, two others injured in northern NSW shooting
items.summary: A man has died and two others injured following a shooting on a property in Murwillumbah in northern NSW.

items.title: Tasmania's local and state governments to pay $650,000 for Foo Fighters concert in Launceston
items.summary: Tasmania's "biggest concert ever" will take place at Launceston's York Park next month when American rock band Foo Fighters play their only Australian show.

items.title: Tension remains at City of Perth as lord mayor backs down from culture review amid public backlash
items.summary: Perth Lord Mayor Bruce Reynolds has backed down from his controversial plan to hold an independent Workplace Culture Review, citing "competing legal commentary, public dispute and media noise", but maintains his concerns were valid.

items.title: How to prepare yourself and your child for the social media ban on December 10
items.summary: From December 10, young people will lose access to part of their online world. Here's how to support them.

items.title: Is it better to sleep naked or wear pyjamas in summer?
items.summary: What you wear to bed can affect the quality of your sleep. And if that's nothing at all, there are a few things to consider.

items.title: Why dating your therapist is almost never OK
items.summary: A new code of conduct for for Australian psychologists provides updated guidance that it's almost never OK to date someone who is or has been a client, even if that was years ago.
